lines.text: I wish I could go to New York with yuh.
Now, Homer, you're gonna be fillin' my shoes, stationmaster of Desert Hole!

[dejectedly]
Yeah.

[optimistically]
In exactly 52 years you'll be getting your pension. Then you'll be on your way to wine, women, and song.
In 52 years who'll be able to sing?
What if this kid doesn't die in three weeks? What if he just keeps on living?
Why, I wouldn't let him do a thing like that to you, Oliver!
[Oliver does a reactive take]

[to Oliver Stone]
And there's always politics, Oliver. Think what it means to be a senator! Your mail goes for free.
Waiter! Bottle of ginger ale for Mr. Flagg!

[disappointed that it's not champagne]
Bottle of ginger ale for Mr. Flagg.
Domestic!

[to Dr. Harris as he sees a skeleton in his office closet]
You probably thought nothing was wrong with him either!

[running excitedly around his expensive hotel suite]
Another bathroom! So shiny, so clean you gotta wash up before you go in there!

[flirtatiously on board a plane]
Now you tell me where you live, and i'll pick you up.
My dear doctor, I live on the front page of the Morning Chronicle.
On the what?

[Louder]
On the front page of the Morning Chronicle, and you can pick me up for seven cents! Now climb back in your horse and buggy and try your bedside manner on someone else!

[Hearing the screech of the wheels touching down on the runway]
What was that?
We just came down to Earth!

[to Homer]
They'll boil you in oil in Macy's window after they marinate you for a week in Gimbel's.
Oh, come on, Oliver, where's your sense of humor?

[after she laughs]
You were going to marry him. He would have done to you what he did to the paper.
[she stops laughing]

[angrily]
Why that two-timing little fraud!
Where's YOUR sense of humor?
...in a couple of hours the whole city of New York is going to be banging at the door howling for your blood!
Why, I ain't got enough for everybody!
Oh, I'm feelin' much better this morning. I heard a bird sing.
Yeah, I heard the same bird sing, Homer, - SING SING!
Wha - ho - unh! The fever's coming back!

[to Wally]
I am sitting here, Miss Cook, toying with the idea of removing your heart and stuffing it like an olive.
